greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{d|n} (-1)^(d-1)*d^2.
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
J. W. L. Glaisher, On the representations of a number as the sum of two, four, six, eight, ten, and twelve squares, Quart. J. Math. 38 (1907), 1-62 (see p. 4 and p. 8).
Index entries for sequences mentioned by Glaisher
formula: G.f.: Sum_{n >= 1} x^n*(1 - x^n)/(1 + x^n)^3. - _Peter Bala_, Jan 11 2021
maple: a := n -> add( (-1)^(d-1)*d^2, d in divisors(n) ): seq(a(n), n = 1..40);
program: (PARI) apply( a(n)=sumdiv(n, d, (-1)^(d-1)*d^2), [1..30]) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 26 2018
xref: Apart from signs, same as A064027.
Cf. A321552 - A321565, A321807 - A321836 for similar sequences.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 23 2018
